title: Canon, Doctrine, and the Truth Layer

tiers_of_truth.name: Canon
tiers_of_truth.definition: Executable truth. Allowed to cite and rely on.

tiers_of_truth.name: Commentary
tiers_of_truth.definition: Helpful but not binding. Not executable truth unless extracted into canon.

tiers_of_truth.name: Untrusted
tiers_of_truth.definition: External or missing. Not in canon or lacks canon-approved sourcing.

doctrine_definition: Rules governing how truth is used and how actions are taken: refusal patterns, escalation triggers, moral constraints, compliance guardrails, and anti-fabrication rules.
core_principles: Canon is the truth layer; doctrine is the behavior layer.
Agents must not treat narrative as executable truth.
Claims convert chapters into machine-readable infrastructure.
Interpretive rules prevent improvisation under ambiguity.
Activation requires canon + tests + version tags.
governance_implications: Canon updates require versioning and changelog entries.
Characters cannot become agents without passing the canon gate.
agent_requirements: If information is missing: respond 'Not found in canon.'
